translations.login_bar.log_in.label: Log in with Google
translations.login_bar.log_out.label: Log out
translations.login_bar.logged_in_as.label: You are logged in as
translations.my_vocab.add_adjective.grund_form.label: Base form:
translations.my_vocab.add_adjective.heading: Add adjective
translations.my_vocab.add_adjective.help_1: Enter the base, t- and long forms.
translations.my_vocab.add_adjective.help_2: The comparative and superlative may also be provided, or can be omitted (so "mest" and "mere" plus the base form are assumed).
translations.my_vocab.add_adjective.help_3: The inflection isn't saved; it's just something that can be a helpful shortcut to entering the forms. For example, use something like "-t, -e" for just the t- and long forms, or e.g. "-t, -e -mere, -mest" if you also want the comparative and superlative.
translations.my_vocab.add_adjective.inflection.label: Inflection:
translations.my_vocab.add_adjective.komparativ.label: Comparative:
translations.my_vocab.add_adjective.lang_form.label: Long form:
translations.my_vocab.add_adjective.superlativ.label: Superlative:
translations.my_vocab.add_adjective.t_form.label: t- form:
translations.my_vocab.add_noun.definite_plural.label: Danish (definite plural form):
translations.my_vocab.add_noun.gender.label: Gender:
translations.my_vocab.add_noun.heading: Add noun
translations.my_vocab.add_noun.help_1: In Word Filth a noun has a gender, at least one form in Danish, and a translation in English.
translations.my_vocab.add_noun.help_2: The inflection isn't saved; it's just something that can be a helpful shortcut to entering the forms.
translations.my_vocab.add_noun.inflection.label: Inflection:
translations.my_vocab.add_phrase.heading: Add phrase
translations.my_vocab.add_phrase.help: In Word Filth a phrase has a Danish form, and an English form. It is the most free-form type of vocabulary entry.
translations.my_vocab.add_verb.datid.label: Past:
translations.my_vocab.add_verb.førnutid.label: Past participle:
translations.my_vocab.add_verb.heading: Add verb
translations.my_vocab.add_verb.help_1: Enter the present, past, and past participle forms.
translations.my_vocab.add_verb.help_2: The inflection isn't saved; it's just something that can be a helpful shortcut to entering the forms. For example, enter "-r, -de, -t" for group 1.
translations.my_vocab.add_verb.infinitive.label: Infinitive:
translations.my_vocab.add_verb.inflection.label: Inflection:
translations.my_vocab.add_verb.nutid.label: Present:
translations.my_vocab.delete.confirmation.1: Are you sure you want to delete the selected item?
translations.my_vocab.delete.confirmation.>1: Are you sure you want to delete the selected {{count}} items?
translations.my_vocab.shared.language.label: Language:
translations.question.builtin_verb.given_infinitive.a: All three tenses must be filled in
translations.question.builtin_verb.given_infinitive.h: If you enter "1" for Present, then the answers are filled in as per group 1; use "2" for group 2. The answers can be edited before they are submitted.

For example, if you think that the verb is regular group 1, then type "1", press enter, then press enter again. But if you think it's almost group 1, but not quite, then type "1", press enter, edit, and press enter again.
translations.question.builtin_verb.given_infinitive.q: How do you inflect the verb {{infinitive}}?
translations.question.shared.how_do_you_say_in_danish: How do you say in Danish, {{english}}?
translations.question.shared.how_do_you_say_in_englis: How do you say in English, {{danish}}?
translations.settings.disable_builtin_verbs.label: Deactivate built-in list of verbs
translations.settings.enable_babbel.label: Activate Babbel
translations.settings.vocabulary_language.header: Default, when you add to your vocabulary:
translations.show_results.heading: Your results
translations.show_verb_list.heading: List of verbs
translations.show_your_data.delete_explanation: You may also delete your data, by replacing it with {{code}}.
translations.show_your_data.general_explanation: Here you can see your data. You are free to edit it if you like, but it can of course cause errors, if it's not in the right structure.
translations.show_your_data.heading: Your data
translations.show_your_data.update_question: Are you sure you want to update your data?
translations.tester.heading: Practice
translations.tester.zero_questions: Nothing to see here at the moment :-)
translations.welcome.para_1: Word Filth helps you improve your Danish, using spaced repetition. There's a built-in list of more than 300 verbs, but you can also add your own words and phrases.
translations.welcome.para_2: Word Filth uses "Log in with Google", so that your results can be saved online. You can download or delete your own data at any time.
